articles.title: Updates to Studio, YouTube Live, new gen AI tools, and everything else announced at Made on YouTube
articles.summary: YouTube unveiled tons of new updates, features, and tools geared toward creators.

articles.title: Lincoln Center’s Collider Fellows explore how tech could transform the performing arts
articles.summary: At a time of high anxiety around technology’s impact on arts and culture, Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts’ Collider Fellowship is focused on new opportunities, welcoming multi-disciplinary artists to explore how emerging tech can transform live performance and the performing arts.

articles.title: Only 7 days left to save on TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 tickets — lock in Regular Bird pricing now
articles.summary: Time is running out to grab your pass to TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, happening October 27–29 in San Francisco. With less than 7 days left to lock in Regular Bird pricing, now’s your chance to save up to $668 on your ticket and join 10,000+ founders, investors, and builders at one of the most iconic startup conferences of the year.

articles.title: Octopus Energy spins off its Kraken utility billing and AI platform
articles.summary: The British renewable energy provider said that its Kraken platform had $500 million in committed annual revenue, spurring a spinoff that could result in a massive IPO.

articles.title: AI-designed viruses are here and already killing bacteria
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can draw cat pictures and write emails. Now the same technology can compose a working genome. A research team in California says it used AI to propose new genetic codes for viruses—and managed to get several of these viruses to replicate and kill bacteria. The scientists, based at Stanford University and the nonprofit…

articles.title: De-risking investment in AI agents
articles.summary: Automation has become a defining force in the customer experience. Between the chatbots that answer our questions and the recommendation systems that shape our choices, AI-driven tools are now embedded in nearly every interaction. But the latest wave of so-called “agentic AI”—systems that can plan, act, and adapt toward a defined goal—promises to push automation…

articles.title: The looming crackdown on AI companionship
articles.summary: As long as there has been AI, there have been people sounding alarms about what it might do to us: rogue superintelligence, mass unemployment, or environmental ruin from data center sprawl. But this week showed that another threat entirely—that of kids forming unhealthy bonds with AI—is the one pulling AI safety out of the academic…

articles.title: Trump announces skilled worker visas will now cost $100,000

articles.title: Prime members can get three months of Kindle Unlimited for free
articles.summary: A cool new perk recently became available for Prime members: for a limited time, you can get a three-month subscription to Kindle Unlimited. If your ebookshelf is looking bare, Amazon is currently offering a three-month subscription to Kindle Unlimited for free. articles.title: The wafer-thin iPhone Air is surprisingly strong
articles.summary: You’d be forgiven for assuming the iPhone Air would snap like a twig under pressure. It’s almost impossibly thin at just 5.6mm. But, its titanium frame is not only stronger than aluminum, it’s also more elastic. YouTuber JerryRigEverything demonstrates this with his usual bend test. While he’s able to get some slight bowing by pressing […]

articles.title: An ICE raid at an EV factory raises fears about US instability
